name: Timeseries Service
description: A Rails service for ingesting and querying timeseries data. Reads data from Kafka topics, asynchronously indexes it into Elasticsearch, and archives data into S3. Exposes GraphQL endpoints to query data in Elasticsearch. Used by the Analytics Team for ingesting and querying crawled-product data.

name: Crawled Product
description: A timeseries entity representing product data that has been crawled from retailer websites. Contains fields such as product_id, brand, name, retailer_external_id, RSU, URL, price, description, feature_bullets, images, videos, reviews, ratings, ranks, and various content grade scores (title_grade, description_grade, bullets_grade, a_plus_content_grade, images_grade, etc.).

name: Content Grade
description: Quality scoring metrics for crawled product content. Includes overall_grade, title_grade, description_grade, bullets_grade, a_plus_content_grade, images_grade, image_resolution_grade, ratings_grade, and reviews_grade. Used to assess the quality and completeness of product listings on retailer websites.

name: A+ Content Grade
description: A quality score for A+ Content (enhanced brand content) on crawled product listings. Part of the content grading system in the timeseries-service used by the Analytics Team to evaluate product page quality.

name: Price History Widget
description: A UI widget for displaying historical price data for products. Part of the Analytics functionality that relies on timeseries-service for data storage and retrieval.
